name: Cotton Rose
climate: Cotton Rose thrives well in subtropical to tropical climates with warm temperatures.
It prefers climates where there are long, warm growing seasons and mild winters.
High humidity levels are beneficial for the growth of Cotton Rose plants.
Avoid areas with prolonged cold and frost as they can damage the plant severely.
sunlight: Cotton Rose grows best in full sun where it receives direct sunlight for most of the day.
Partial shade is also tolerated but may result in reduced flowering and growth.
Ensure the plant gets at least 6 to 8 hours of sunlight each day for optimal blooms.
Lack of adequate sunlight may lead to leggy growth and fewer flowers.
watering: Water the Cotton Rose regularly to keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
During dry spells, increase the watering frequency to maintain adequate moisture.
Ensure the plant has good drainage to prevent root rot caused by overwatering.
In winter, reduce watering slightly, as the plant needs less water during dormancy.
soil: Cotton Rose prefers well-draining soil enriched with organic matter for best growth.
A slightly acidic to neutral soil pH is suitable for cultivating Cotton Rose plants.
Sandy loam soils are ideal as they provide appropriate drainage and aeration.
Avoid heavy, clayey soils that retain water and may lead to root health issues.
extra_care_tip: Prune the Cotton Rose after flowering to maintain shape and encourage bushy growth.
Protect the plant from strong winds, as its branches can be fragile and break easily.
Mulching around the base helps retain moisture and suppress weeds, promoting healthier growth.
